phrase.cizu_name: go spare Brit. informal 英，非正式

jx.jx_en_mean: be unwanted or not needed and therefore available for use

lj.lj_ly: I didn't have much money going spare.
I didn't have much money going spare.

phrase.cizu_name: spare no expense (或 no expense spared)

jx.jx_en_mean: be prepared to pay any amount (used to indicate the importance of achieving something)

phrase.cizu_name: spare the rod and spoil the child

lj.lj_ly: spare a thought for our volunteer group at Christmas.
lj.lj_ls: 圣诞节别忘了我们的志愿者组织。

jx.jx_en_mean: In addition to what is needed

lj.lj_ly: We paid our bills and had money to spare.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English spær 'not plentiful, meagre', sparian 'refrain from injuring', refrain from using, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch and German sparen 'to spare'

entry.def: You use spare to describe something that is the same as things that you are already using, but that you do not need yet and are keeping ready in case another one is needed.

example.ex: If possible keep a spare pair of glasses accessible in case your main pair is broken or lost...
example.tran: 如果有可能的话，最好准备一副备用眼镜，以防常用的那副眼镜打碎或者丢失。

example.ex: Don't forget to take a few spare batteries...
example.tran: 别忘了带上几节备用电池。

entry.def: You use spare to describe something that is not being used by anyone, and is therefore available for someone to use.

example.ex: They don't have a lot of spare cash...
The spare bedroom is on the second floor...

entry.tran: 剩余，剩下(时间、金钱或空间)
entry.def: If you have something such as time, money, or space to spare, you have some extra time, money, or space that you have not used or which you do not need.

example.ex: You got here with ninety seconds to spare...
example.tran: 你到这里的时候还剩 90 秒钟时间。

example.ex: It's not as if he has money to spare...

entry.tran: 抽出，拨出(金钱或其他资源)
entry.def: If you spare time or another resource for a particular purpose, you make it available for that purpose.

example.ex: She said that she could only spare 35 minutes for our meeting...
example.tran: 她说她只能抽出 35 分钟时间参加我们的会议。

example.ex: He's a very busy man, and it's good of him to spare the time to visit...
example.tran: 他是个大忙人，能抽出时间到访真是太好了。

entry.def: If a person or a place is spared, they are not harmed, even though other people or places have been.

example.ex: We have lost everything, but thank God, our lives have been spared...
example.tran: 我们已经失去了一切，不过谢天谢地，总算是保住了性命。

entry.def: If you spare someone an unpleasant experience, you prevent them from suffering it.

example.ex: I wanted to spare Frances the embarrassment of discussing this subject...
example.tran: 讨论这个话题太尴尬，我不想让弗朗西斯难堪。

example.ex: Prisoners are spared the indignity of wearing uniforms...
example.tran: 囚犯们不必忍受身穿囚服的侮辱。

entry.def: Someone who is described as spare is tall and not at all fat.

example.ex: She was thin and spare, with a sharply intelligent face.
example.tran: 她又高又瘦，一副精明过人的模样。

entry.tran: 简单的;不加修饰的;简朴的
entry.def: Something such as a room that is spare is very plain with no unnecessary features.

example.ex: Inside, the two small rooms were spare and neat, stripped bare of ornaments.
example.tran: 进去以后是两个简单而整洁的小房间，朴实无华，没有什么装饰。

entry.def: If you spare no effort in doing something, you do it as well as possible, without worrying about the amount of work involved. If you spare no expense in doing it, you do it as well as possible, without trying to save money.

example.ex: The government is determined to spare no effort in investigating this case thoroughly...
example.tran: 政府决定不遗余力地彻底调查这个案子。

example.ex: Officials say they'll spare no expense to prevent another riot.
example.tran: 官员说他们会不惜一切地阻止再次发生暴乱。

entry.def: If you spare a thought for an unfortunate person, you make an effort to think sympathetically about them and their bad luck.

example.ex: Spare a thought for the nation's shopkeepers — consumer sales slid again in May...
example.tran: 可怜一下这个国家的店老板吧—— 5 月份消费品的销售量又下滑了。

example.ex: I do not think any of us spared a thought for the ordeal of her crew.
example.tran: 我不认为我们中间有任何一个人同情过这艘船的船员所遭受的磨难。

means.word_mean: 1. an extra component of a machine or other apparatus
2. an extra car wheel and tire for a four-wheel vehicle
3. a score in tenpins; knocking down all ten after rolling two balls
2. save or relieve from an experience or action;

sentences.sentence: "I'll spare you from having to apologize formally"

means.word_mean: 3. give up what is not strictly needed;

sentences.sentence: "he asked if they could spare one of their horses to speed his journey"
"the spare figure of a marathon runner"

means.word_mean: 2. more than is needed, desired, or required;

sentences.sentence: "found some extra change lying on the dresser"
"yet another book on heraldry might be thought redundant"
"it was supererogatory of her to gloat"
"extra ribs as well as other supernumerary internal parts"
"the library had a spare but efficient look"

means.word_mean: 4. not taken up by scheduled activities;
5. kept in reserve especially for emergency use;

auth_sentence.content: What he did in his spare time is irrelevant.
auth_sentence.res_content: What he did in his spare time is irrelevant.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: What he did in his spare time is irrelevant.

auth_sentence.content: This meant a top-eight finish to spare national blushes.
auth_sentence.res_content: This meant a top-eight finish to spare national blushes.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This meant a top-eight finish to spare national blushes.

auth_sentence.content: Spare ribs and salad with the celebrity pig farmer.
auth_sentence.res_content: Spare ribs and salad with the celebrity pig farmer.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Spare ribs and salad with the celebrity pig farmer.

abbreviation.mean_en: steam power automation and results computer
abbreviation.mean_cn: 蒸汽动力自动控制和处理计算机

Sentence.sentence: And it is not just individuals: the web makes it easier for companies to rent out spare offices and idle machines, too.
The results of a Harry's poll showed that reading was the most popular spare time activity in the US.
He spends his spare time doing repairs

Manufacturing's shrinking presence undoubtedly helps explain the decline in craftsmanship, if only because many of the nation's assembly line workers were skilled in craft work, if not on the job then in their spare time.
But can you spare me a second?
In Einstein's day, there were only a few thousand physicists worldwide, and the theoreticians who could intellectually rival Einstein probably would fit into a streetcar with seats to spare.

means.word_mean: 节省, 节约, 舍不得, 吝惜

sentences.en: She never spares the butter when baking.
sentences.cn: 她煎饼时从不吝惜黄油。

means.word_mean: 抽出, 让给, 分出, 匀出, 腾出

sentences.en: Could you spare some time to come to our art exhibition?
sentences.cn: 你能抽出时间来看看我们的画展吗?

sentences.en: The doctor tried to spare him from pain.
sentences.cn: 医生尽力使他免受痛苦。

means.word_mean: 饶恕, 赦免, 不伤害

sentences.en: His harsh criticism spared no one.
sentences.cn: 他的严厉批评伤害了大众。

means.word_mean: (尤指不会造成不便或损失地)供给；给予

sentences.en: Would you please spare me a cup of wine?
Do you carry a spare wheel in the back of your car?
sentences.cn: 你在车后带了一个备用的轮胎吗?

sentences.en: These pieces of bread are spare, I don't need them.
sentences.cn: 这些面包是多余的, 我不需要。

sentences.en: His tall and spare frame cut an impressive figure.
sentences.cn: 他那修长的身材给人以深刻印象。

means.word_mean: 备用零件; 备用轮胎

sentences.en: I'll show you where the spares are kept.
sentences.cn: 我会指给你看放备件的地方。

jushi.english: Thank you all very, very much for sparing your valuable time.
jushi.chinese: 十分感谢你们能抽出宝贵的时间。

jushi.english: Are you sure you can spare these tapes?
jushi.chinese: 你能肯定这些磁带你们暂时不用吗?

jushi.english: More pancakes, please, and don't spare the syrup.
jushi.chinese: 请再来些薄烤饼,多放些糖浆。
